org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.AbstractServiceAdmin
      • org.apache.river.qa.harness.ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Admin

    public class ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin
extends AbstractServiceAdmin
implements Admin
    An admin for an activatable service which uses SharedActivatableServiceDescriptor to start the service, and which uses ServiceDestroyer to stop the service. The parameters which define the service are obtained as described in AbstractServiceAdmin extended by this implementation. Additional parameter defined by this admin include:

    restart boolean value for the restart flag

    The logger named org.apache.river.qa.harness.service is used to log debug information

    Level Description
    FINE parameter values used to start the service, and a message indicating whether shared VM mode is being used

      • start

        public void start()
           throws RemoteException,
                  TestException
        Configures and starts an instance of the service described by the serviceName provided in the constructor. This method retrieves several parameters by constructing parameter names using the prefix and a set of well-known tokens.

        The option arguments for the service are generated, containing the name of the service configuration file and overrides for the groups, locators membergroups, and persistence log entries to be used by the service. A SharedActivatableServiceDescriptor is created using these arguments and other required parameters (i.e. classpath, codebase, etc). If a descriptor transformer was registered with this admin, the transformers transform method is called with the descriptor before calling the descriptors create method.

        If a SharedGroupAdmin was not provided in the constructor, one is created and started when getServiceSharedLogDir is called in the service descriptor constructor. The serviceName used to construct the admin for the shared group is "sharedGroup". If the shared group must be created and the activation system is not running, the activation system will be started.

        After the service is started, the service proxy is prepared using the prepared using the prepared name returned by the getServicePreparerName method.

        This admin administratively sets the lookup port, lookup group and locators, and any member groups that were specified and also passed as overrides. This behavior is considered temporary until all services have been converted to honor the override entry names.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Admin
        Throws:
        TestException - if any of the mandatory service starter parameters cannot be found. The mandatory well-known tokens are: impl, codebase, classpath, policyfile. It is also thrown if any exception is thrown while attempting to start the service, or if generation of the configuration file fails.
        RemoteException - never. Any RemoteExceptions which occur while attempting to start the service will be wrapped in a TestException.

      • killVM

        public void killVM()
            throws RemoteException
        Kill the service VM by calling the killVM method on the group admin.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communications error occured while making the remote call to the killVM backend server

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws RemoteException
        Administratively destroys the service managed by this admin, and waits for up to ServiceDestroyer.DEFAULT_N_SECS_WAIT seconds for the service to unregister its activation group from the activation service. Failure to unregister is silently ignored. If the activation group is private to this service, then the activation group is also destroyed by calling the stop method of it's admin.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Admin
        Throws:
        RemoteException - when a communication failure occurs between the front-end and the back-end of the service while attempting to destroy the service. When this exception does occur, the service may or may not have been successfully destroyed. If an ActivationException occurs, the exception is wrapped in a thrown RemoteException

      • stopAndWait

        public int stopAndWait(int nSecsWait)
                throws RemoteException,
                       ActivationException
        Administratively destroys the service managed by this admin. This method attempts to verify that the desired service is actually destroyed. If a private shared group is associated with this service, this method will always attempt to destroy that group. Failure to destroy the group will generate a stack trace but will not affect the return semantics of the call.
        Parameters:
        nSecsWait - the number of seconds to wait for the service's activation ID to be no longer registered with the the activation system
        Returns:
        int value that indicates either success or one of a number of possible reasons for failure to destroy the service. Possible values are:

        • ServiceDestroyer.DESTROY_SUCCESS
        • ServiceDestroyer.SERVICE_NOT_ADMINISTRABLE - returned when the service to destroy is not an instance of net.jini.admin.Administrable
        • ServiceDestroyer.SERVICE_NOT_DESTROY_ADMIN - returned when the service to destroy is not an instance of org.apache.river.admin.DestroyAdmin
        • ServiceDestroyer.DEACTIVATION_TIMEOUT - returned when the service's activation group is still registered with the activation system after the number of seconds to wait have passed
        • ServiceDestroyer.PERSISTENT_STORE_EXISTS - returned when the directory in which the service stores its persistent state still exists after the service has been successfully destroyed
        Throws:
        RemoteException - typically, this exception occurs when there is a communication failure between the client and the service's backend. When this exception does occur, the service may or may not have been successfully destroyed.
        ActivationException - typically, this exception occurs when problems arise while attempting to interact with the activation system

      • getServiceSharedLogDir

        protected String getServiceSharedLogDir()
                                 throws TestException
        Return the shared VM log directory name associated with this activatable service. If a SharedGroupAdmin was not passed in the constructor for this class, then if a global shared group is needed, that group is created through the admin manager; otherwise, a SharedGroupAdmin private to this service is created and its start method is called.
        Returns:
        the shared vm log directory name
        Throws:
        TestException - if this method attempts to start a shared group and the attempt fails

      • getSharedLogDir

        public String getSharedLogDir()
        Return the shared log directory name originally returned by the getServiceSharedLogDir method.
        Returns:
        the service shared log directory name

      • getServiceRestart

        protected boolean getServiceRestart()
        Return the value of the restart parameter to use when registering an activatable service. The environment is searched for a value for the key serviceName + ".restart". The value is interpreted as a boolean, and has the default value of true.
        Returns:
        the value of the restart parameter

      • getRestart

        public boolean getRestart()
        Return the restart value originally returned by the getServiceRestart method.
        Returns:
        the service restart value

      • logServiceParameters

        protected void logServiceParameters()
                             throws TestException
        Description copied from class: AbstractServiceAdmin
        Generate logging output displaying the parameters which were provided by the accessors of this class. If a subclass provides additional accessor methods, that class should provide an override of this method, first calling super.logServiceParameters and then log records for the accessor values added by the subclass should be written. The source information is set to null in the log records to improve the readability of the output. In most cases, output for a parameter is generated only if that parameter was initialized through its getServiceXXX accessor.
        Overrides:
        logServiceParameters in class AbstractServiceAdmin
        Throws:
        TestException - if the type property is undefined.
